Description: Egyptian terracotta flask in form of head of Dionysos/Bacchus or Silenos. Head is bearded, with a wreath of vine-leaves, and with ivy-berries each side of the forehead, giving the general effect of a bunch of grapes. The broken mouth of the flask emerges from the top of the head; the back is plain. From two-piece mould, with the front and part of the rear once thickly covered with a white dressing, with surviving areas of red paint. Brown Nile silt with frequent fine gold mica and white inclusions.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Flask in the form of Dionysus (Bailey 2008: 99; Fischer 1994: 448), with close parallels (Breccia 1934: pl. cvii:618; Pagenstecher 1913: 102, fig. 102a and b and pl. xxxvi:2) and similar example from Middle Egypt, dated late Hellenistic (Besques 1992: no. D/E 4551) or undated (from the Fayum, Perdrizet 1921: no. 199; Christie’s New York, Sale Catalogue, 9 December 2005: lot 288; LIMC iii (2): pl. 124, Botrys 5). However a number of similar examples are dated Roman (Dunand 1990: nos 1000 and 1001), or 1st to early 2nd century AD (Bayer-Niemeier 1988: 283, Pl.130, no. 760; Fischer 1994: no. 1249). Bayer-Niemeier, E. 1988. ‘Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik. Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann, 1. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten’. Melsungen. Besques, S. 1992. ‘Catalogue raisonné des figurines et reliefs en terre-cuite grecs, étrusques et romains, 4, 2. Epoques hellénistique et romaine. Cyrénaïque, Egypte ptolémaïque et romaine, Afrique du Nord et Proche-Orient’. Paris. Breccia, E. 1934. ‘Terrecotte figurate greche e greco-egizie del Museo di Alessandria, vol. II’. Bergamo. Dunand, F. 1990. ‘Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Catalogue des terres cuites grécoromaines d'Egypte’. Paris. Fischer, J. 1994. ‘Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen’. Tübingen : Wasmuth. Pagenstecher, R. 1913. ‘Die griechische-äegyptische Sammlung Ernst von Sieglin, part III: Gefässe in Stein und Ton; Knochenschitzereien.’ Leipzig. Perdrizet, P. 1921. ‘Les Terres cuites grecques d’Égypte de la collection Fouquet.’ Nancy.
